home
A tool to manage classpaths and clojure namespaces on a persistent JVM

Namespace utilities

Jark provides some interesting namespace utilities. Let us start by loading a file that has a namespace defined in it.

(ns factorial)

(defn compute [n] 
  (let [n (Integer. n)]    
    (apply * (take n (iterate inc 1)))))

(defn fact-map [n] 
  (let [n (Integer. n)]
    (zipmap (take n (iterate inc 1))
            (map factorial/compute (take n (iterate inc 1))))))

client> jark ns load ./factorial.clj

Running it is really simple:

client> jark factorial compute 10

Let us now define a fact-map function.

client> jark ns repl factorial to get to the repl for the ‘factorial’ namespace. Let us now map the factorial function over a range 0 .. n.

To output in json, do:

client> jark ns json factorial fact-map 3
 => {"3" : 6, "2" : 2, "1" : 1}
